messages.content: What is sd-dynamic-thresholding and what does it do?

sd-dynamic-thresholding is an extension for ComfyUI, StableSwarmUI, and AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI that enables higher CFG Scales without color issues. It works by clamping latents between steps.
Who developed the core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding?
The core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding was originally developed by Birch-san and later ported to the WebUI by dtan3847.
How can I install sd-dynamic-thresholding in ComfyUI?

You can use either of the following methods: Option A (TODO: Manager install), or Option B: `cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes` & `git clone https://github.com/mcmonkeyprojects/sd-dynamic-thresholding` and then restart ComfyUI.
What node should I add in ComfyUI to use sd-dynamic-thresholding?
Add node `advanced/mcmonkey/DynamicThresholdingSimple` (or `Full`) in ComfyUI to use the extension.
How can I configure sd-dynamic-thresholding within the Infinity Grid Generator extension?
Please refer to the readme of the Infinity Grid Generator extension for details on how to configure sd-dynamic-thresholding.
Which versions of the ComfyUI KSampler node can use the sd-dynamic-thresholding?
The extension can work with any variant of the `KSampler` node, including custom ones, as long as they do not totally override the internal sampling function.
What licensing pre-note should I be aware of when using sd-dynamic-thresholding?
This is an open source project provided entirely freely, so if you make any changes that could benefit the community as a whole, please contribute upstream.
What does the MIT License permit in the context of the sd-dynamic-thresholding usage?
The MIT License permits you to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sell, and sublicense copies of the tool, subject to certain conditions.
What does the license not permit in the case of the sd-dynamic-thresholding usage?
You may not hold any developer liable for what you do with the software.
